item.description:
Oi pessoal, esse Carnaval no domingo sera massa. Vai incluir carnavais de varios paises afro-caribes!

Eh um evento anual que comecou 15 anos atras. Quanto custa? Entrada de graca, graca, graca!

Ja fui para o Cambridge Carnaval anos atras quando o evento era pequeno e acontecia no Central Square mas nos ultimos anos, cresceu demais e em 2005, para lidar com tal crescimento, eles mudaram para o Kendall Square. O Central Sq ainda ta incluido na festa pois eh la onde a passeata vai comecar!

Do site proprio do evento:
About Cambridge Carnival International


Celebrating 15 Years of Fun & Diversity

Caribbean Carnival International, is a colorful and festive celebration that is rooted in African traditions. Carnival secretly allowed public communication and cultural bonding for the Afro-Caribbean cultures from as far back as the 1600s.

The rich rhythmic musicality and culture of the Caribbean can be seen as revelers masquerade through the streets in dazzling handmade costumes dancing to the beat of Carnival.

Cambridge Carnival in Massachusetts, is one of twenty-four North American Caribbean-style carnivals that combine wire-bending, costumes, masks, music, steel pan, street-parades, dancing, food and craft exhibits, to display the diverse cultures of all the countries and Caribbean islands, where transplanted Africans were placed.

Since its inception in 1992, Cambridge Carnival has grown from a small street fair to one of the most spectacular events in Cambridge and the Greater Boston area. This growth led to, in 2005, a change in venue from Central Sq. to its new home in Kendall Square.

---

Mas, nao eh so um evento afro-caribeano. Tambem, tera cultura e musica brasileira, como por exemplo - SAMBA TREMETERRA.

Veja aqui quais grupos vao se apresentar.
Entertainment

This year's festival will feature seven entertainment zones: a live music zone with Reggae, Soca, Calypso, World Music, and New Orleans's Jazz; a KidsFest zone; 4 DJ zones representing a variety of music from the Caribbean, and a steel band zone.

Musicians/Performers
Musical accompaniments have set the tone for worldwide carnival celebrations. Bands representing several island and South American nations provide the sounds of Afro-Cuban, Brazilian, Caribbean, Calypso, Reggae, Compa, Punta, and Salsa music.

2007 Confirmed live music bands for on the main stage include: Hot 8 Brass Band (New Orleans Jazz), Zili Roots (World Music), Ilibash (Reggae) Santa Mamba (Latin Music), Samba Tremeterra, Brazilian Cultural Center (Brazilian), Tropical Fire (Soca), and Nancia (R&B). DJ Illabash will be featured in the youth section of the festival site (corner of Broadway and Main Street).

Santa Mamba performance sponsored in part by Tri-Z Studio.

KidsFest
A KidsFest zone offers free, interactive activities for children ages 4+ and will feature the Children?s Museum and the Museum of Science. Other free activities include stilt walking from Open Air Circus; the Just for Fun moon bounce; Agenda for Children will be offering books; and there will be an arts and craft activities, including face painting and mask making. And, of course, we will be selling popcorn! Click here to download the Kidsfest schedule.
---

Em um site outro de atividades, eh bem divulgado. Os administradores indicaram o Cambridge Carnaval International como um dos melhores eventos da semana.

Vixe maria, vai ser otimo!

Como chegar:
A estacao do T (o metro) mais perta para ver a passeata eh o Central Square na linha vermelho.
Para ir direitamente para a festa, desca na estacao de Kendall Square, tambem na linha vermelho. Sera na cruzado de Main St. e Ames St.

Andando de carro nao eh sugerido pois muitas ruas nessa area vao ser fechadas por causa da passeata.

group.name: The Boston/Cambridge Portuguese Language Meetup Group

item.name: Cambridge Carnaval International!!!
